text:
(1)
8024 Eighteenth Ave., at the N.W. corner of 81st Street, showing a rear view of the home of Mrs. Wardell which was erected in 1873. In 1929 the Bensonhurst Garden Apartments occupied the site.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing another house on Eighteenth Ave.

March 1925.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Eighteenth Ave., east side, from and including 81st to and including 82nd Streets, showing the Van Pelt Manor. Also showing between the two benches in the foreground, is the milestone which reads: - 8 1/4 miles to New York Ferry. This road to Denys' Ferry 2 1/2 miles; 10 1/2 miles to New York Ferry. This road to Jamaica 15 miles. It also marked the postroad from Boston to Philadelphia.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Same, showing side view of house.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Same, from the other side.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Same as No. 2.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

1776-1778 81st Street, south side, west of Eighteenth Ave., showing the Dr. Carpenter house, formerly at 8212 Eighteenth Ave., at its new location.
March 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) Eighteenth Ave., east side, from and including 81st to and including 82nd Streets, showing an old frame building, erected in 1664 and known as the Van Pelt Manor House.
